Run Profitable Campaigns

Every penny spent in your company must be profitable. Even your support activities — non-sales oriented operations — must generate intangible profit like brand trust and customer satisfaction.

But now we will examine how to create and run campaigns increasing revenue. If you spend blindly you can hit the headlines, and, in the same time dig your own grave like Groupon did.

So focus on profit.

Know Your Channels

Using the industry standard Google Analytics terms every website has the following traffic sources — in e-commerce we call them sales channels.

  • Search Traffic — visitors brought to you by search engines like Google, Bing, Yahoo etc.

  • Direct Traffic — visitors who already know you. They go straight to your site without searching or clicking links pointing to you.

  • Referral Traffic — visitors comming to your site via links from other sites. As a result of your link exchange or similar activities.

  • Campaigns — visits brought to you by online advertising platforms like Google Adwords or Facebook Ads.

These are the major sources of revenue for your business. You’ll have to know how they work, how much you can spend on each channel, how much profit they will generate, and when.

Channel Platform How to realize Cost
Search Traffic Google, Yahoo, Bing Search Engine Optimisation Programming
Direct Traffic Brand Awareness Print, Outdoor, Media, Events, etc. Offline advertising (cash or barter)
Referral Traffic Link exchange, Affiliates Gifts, Giveaways, Contest, Revenue Share A percentage of your profit margin
Campaigns Adwords, Facebook ads, Directory listings Buy advertising Cash

There could be other channels like phone sales we are not covering here. Take a break and discover all these for your business.
